Text: Rain showers early with some sunshine later in the day. High 48F. Winds WSW at 10 to 20 mph. Chance of rain 60%.. Partly cloudy. Low 34F. Winds WNW at 10 to 20 mph. Updated: February 25, 2026 @ 12:08 am   Historical artist John Paul Strain has chosen the Cumberland raid for the third painting of his series featuring McNeill’s Rangers. The painting will be released for the Heritage Days Festival in June. CUMBERLAND — One of America’s leading historical artists will be creating a painting depicting the dramatic 1865 raid by McNeill’s Rangers into the city of Cumberland. Historical artist John Paul Strain has chosen the Cumberland raid for the third painting of his series featuring McNeill’s Rangers. The original painting, giclee reproductions on canvas, and archival paper will be released for the Heritage Days Festival in June. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content.
